title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 ยง 76.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 11 ยง 76.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

For purposes of this Part: (a) Commercial crime coverage means coverage under a policy of commercial risk insurance that provides burglary and theft insurance or fidelity insurance; and
(b) Commercial risk insurance has the meaning ascribed by Insurance Law section 107(a)(47). Notes

York State Register December 21, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 51, eff. 7/1/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
